hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When a city needs to protect itself from attackers, there's no choice more reliable than a classic cannon nested atop a keep, combining basic offense with basic defense.
Give a random friendly explosive Weapon +1% Explosive and +1 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Wizard towers are typically where their mystical masters discover the latest ways to blow things up with a well-placed purple fireball. Velmir the Wizard is a famously explosive fellow, and many young wizards model their towers after his iconic abode.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: The Big Laser Pointer is able to focus raw electricity into a pinpoint beam that can penetrate any defense. While it’s one of few Tinker machines that doesn’t regularly backfire, it does regularly take a while to fire.
When this takes Damage, gain +10 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: In the lost era long before The Council began recording the history of the world, many primitive sorcerers worshipped the rare red sun as an early source of magic power. The Red Sun Shrine was built to channel its destructive energy, capturing any light seeping through its many cracks, getting stronger as more fissures emerged.
Give a Defense unit +3 Health for each adjacent Town unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When you need to find a man to man your defenses, no man is better than Jeffrey, the captain of the city guard. He can either be found atop a wall, or in his humble guardhouse. Wait... which guardhouse is his... they all look alike?
When adjacent Town unit triggers, give a random friendly Weapon +0.5 Damage and a random friendly Defense +2 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When adjacent Town unit triggers, give a random friendly Weapon +1 Damage and a random friendly Defense +2 Health.
Start of Combat: Adjacent Town units get 15% speed.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Tinker engineers found a way to send small amounts of sparking magical energy along metal wires, connecting them to buildings to provide light, heat, and lasers, the three most important elements to any Tinker town.
Start of Combat: Friendly Town units gain +2 Health for each one. Passive: When a friendly Town unit triggers, 3 random friendly Nature units gains +1 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Before the shattering, not everyone knew that animals could walk and talk like men. But when the citizens of the deepest wilds were thrust into the skies, they started to form their own communities, like The Big Tree, an entire town of talking creatures that's humbly named after the very big tree in which it resides.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Stone walls might seem rudimentary in an age of magic, but few things get the job done better than a very large wall made of very big rocks.
Deals double Damage to Defense units.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Military tacticians use trebuchets to fire explosives over enemy walls, but sometimes it's useful to fire explosive into enemy walls, which is the perfect task for the Artillery Repeater's rapid volleys of detonating cannonballs.
After Combat: Generate a random Crystal.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: While many magic crystals naturally dot the landscape, any wizards seeking access to more may require the help of a mine to unearth those buried deep inside a skyshard.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When the world shattered, mysterious magical crystals of various colors were scattered across the realm. Different colors imbue the surrounding areas with unique magical properties, sometimes aiding survivability, speed, or raw strength.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When the world shattered, mysterious magical crystals of various colors were scattered across the realm. Different colors imbue the surrounding areas with unique magical properties, sometimes aiding survivability, speed, or raw strength.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When the world shattered, mysterious magical crystals of various colors were scattered across the realm. Different colors imbue the surrounding areas with unique magical properties, sometimes aiding survivability, speed, or raw strength.
The Weapon above this gains +3% Damage of the the Weapon below this (and the other way around).

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Tinker engineers discovered that most weapons don't fully utilize the energy powering them, so they built a machine to harness that excess energy and transfer it to other weapons.
Passive: When you have at least 3 adjacent cooldown units, each time one triggers, a different adjacent unit gets 2% Speed (Destroys itself after 30 triggers)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Wise old wizards say that magical energies never really disipate, they merely transfer into something new. Perhaps that's why they called their enchanting bonfires "eternal" even though they quickly burned out.
This deals Stun Damage. Also stuns itself and 4 additional random enemy units.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Ancient myths warned of a woman crowned with writhing snakes that could turn men to stone, and some dark sects even built statues in her honor. They say if you stare at these stone behemoths for too long, you'll be stunned in fear and as if your insides have turned to stone.
Anytime there are units on to the left, destroy them and split +80% of their Health and +25% of their Damage between the units on the right.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Novus astronomancers discovered that the night skies are home to the most powerful energies in the cosmos. Harnessing terrestial magic seemed so inferior to harnessing the power of the endless dark, and the Materia Contrarium harnesses a mysterious form of dark matter to convert objects into pure unbridled energy.
Passive: When an enemy Weapon attacks, gain +5 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When tinkers need to protect an invention, what better way than to harness pure energy and turn it into an incredibly large mostly-impenetrable wall? The Forcefield can even gather energy from the air to strengthen itself. Is it magic or technology… what’s the difference?
When a friendly Tinker unit triggers, charge this +1. After every 20 charges, trigger 5 random friendly Tinker units.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Tinker inventors know no limits. They don't respect them either. That's why the robot wizard Farnsworth helped them create the Big Red Button, an enormous device that captures excess energy from any nearby Tinker devices. When it has gathered enough, the button is pressed, and objects are hurled in a big circle at incredible speeds, seemingly turning time backwards.
When destroyed, summon 2 smaller Bamboo with 50% Health. (repeats once)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Bamboo is incredibly resilient to damage, seemingly regrowing immediately any time it’s chopped down, as if aided by magic. That’s why many use it as a makeshift defense, planting dense groves on the outskirts of town to block incoming projectiles.
Passive: When this takes Damage, give adjacent units +Health equal to 25% of the Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: These giant mushrooms are known to have curative properties. When their thick fleshy cap is damaged, they release healing spores into the surrounding area.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: It takes a lot of energy to power the advancement of civilization, so Novus wizards harnessed the magnetic forces of floating skyshards to form a small ball of mana that’s ready to be gathered each morning.
Passive: When a friendly Magic gets destroyed, divide its base stats over 3 other friendly units.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Infinity Pools are a resevoirs of pure magic. Whenever a magical artifact is destroyed, any lingering radiant magic is absorbed by the pool, so that other wizards can tap into it and infuse another item with magic.
Start of Combat: Replace the Faction of adjacent units with the Faction of the unit on the right.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Novus holomancers have created intricate arrangements of lenses called Refractors that can manipulate light itself, changing the appearance of any item into an entirely new object.
Start of Combat: Gets +4 Damage for each unique tag you have (Tier, Faction, Type, Role).

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Novus scholars want to bring the world together, harnessing the science of magic to bring society into a new age. By harnessing energies from various factions of wizards, they can create extremely potent weapons like the Assembolator.
When an adjacent unit triggers, charge this +1. When at 20 charges, trigger and reset.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: There were countless wars before The Shattering, leaving an army of abandoned siege weapons dotting the landscape. While many were useless piles of rubble, others were consumed by evil magics, feeding on the death around them. They seemingly gained new life and a thirst for new death. Ancient ballistas are particularly destructive when fueled by dark magic, but require a constant supply of nearby lifeforce in order to fire their enormous bolts.
Passive: Unit on top double-triggers. This deals Damage to the next-closest friendly unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: These enormous creatures are often found attached to powerful magical artifacts, draining the lifeforce from anything nearby in service to its host.
After Combat: Generate a random Utility unit. (Tier 2 and below)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: "No one stocks more than Stockmoore's" is a slogan everyone knows by heart. But anytime something too big for their warehouses needs to be stored, the Stockmoore family is happy to pass it along to enterprising wizards.
Targets the largest enemy unit instead of the closest. Can't target Weapons unless it has no other targets.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Magic is inherently volatile and explosive, which makes it dangerous to handle in large quantities. Whenever wizards need to gather large amounts for a particularly destructive blast of magic, they collect it into an enchanted rocket, point it towards the largest target, and hope for the worst.
Deals extra Damage to units based on their size. (+10 Damage extra per tile)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: After a small miscalculation with a gigantification spell, Magnus permanently transformed himself into a mouse. Although he's still a powerful wizard, he now scurries the halls of his enormous castle, lashing out at anything large.
Start of Combat: Adjacent Town units become Magic. Adjacent Magic units get +25 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Nothing brings a community together like a giant pot of magically flavored soup. Does it burn from the spice... or the magic?
Resummon a random destroyed friendly unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Wherever death goes, Ancient magic follows. That makes graveyards a particularly dangerous place. Barbed crimson tentacles spring forth from the ground, and rumors abound that the undead also rise from the ground.
Passive: When Damaged, adjacent Nature units get +5 Health. When you buy a Tree, get a copy.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: ZapZap wasn't always a helpful wizard. He started life as an helpless orphaned tadpole, taken in by an old druid deep in the forest. Many great wisdoms were bestowed upon the young frog, but the wisest of all was this, "when a lone tree is beset by mighty winds, it may fall. When mighty winds are beset by many trees, the winds will fall."

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Not everyone is a gifted wizard, but a scroll inscribed with a spell can be used by anyone in a pinch. Industrious wizards run factories that can produce these scroll as a massive scale.
Start of Combat: Spread 10 random Enchantments between all adjacent units. Also add one to your Inventory.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: Reflects 30% Damage back to the source.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: After every trigger, changes Damage Effect and Faction.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Targets the 3 closest enemies instead of 1. On trigger: Loses 1 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Tinkers are always finding new ways to harness electric magical energies, and their latest invention is a giant tower that was supposed to provide energy to other devices, without any wires required! Instead it fires off blasts of energy until it all eventually dissipates.
Start of Combat: Trigger the Cooldown of the bottom unit, it loses 40% Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Tinker engineers are always trying to push things to their limit, and sometimes even further. The jumpstarter infuses buildings and devices with a jolt of energy that kicks them into gear. It also catches them on fire.
Passive: When this gets 2 or more Health at once from another unit, it attacks.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Few things strike fear into the heart of a man than the sight of a Piranha Plant. Their enormous barbed bulbs secrete a deadly corrosive acid, perfect for dissolving any food that has been captured inside, living or dead. When a Piranha Plant has eaten enough, it will spit out any excess acid, hurling it a great distance, so as not to damage potential prey in the vicinity. Some people have abused this fact by keeping particularly well-fed plants as weapons.
Deals Damage equal to 15% of the Health of adjacent Defense units. (Damage can't be buffed otherwise)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: All friendly and enemy cooldowns are increased by 0.2s.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: When an adjacent unit dies, resummon it with 10% of its base Health. (doesn't stack)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: When a friendly Defense unit gets destroyed, a random friendly Weapon gains +1 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: The dark magic of necromancy has gained many new initiates after the shattering, preying on all the lost warriors fighting for their stake in a remade realm. Many necromancers set up ramshackle huts on the outskirts of cities, ready to recruit a “fresh” new follower, or sell their services to desperate citizens.
Passive: Adjacent units take 15% less damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Shadewoods are the largest natural trees in the world. Some specific trees might be enhanced by wizards in need, but Shadewoods don’t require any help to reach their staggering heights. They provide a protective canopy over other smaller plants, covering them from sunlight, or perhaps shielding them from an endless torrent of magic hellfire.
Passive: Ignore the first 3 instances of Damage it takes.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: A particularly tidy Tinker inventor created a robotic arm to buff clean all the almost-shatter-proof windows in his workshop, but greedier business partners saw an opportunity to militarize his invention, using the robotic arm to brace the almost-shatter-proof glass from attacks!
When destroyed, deals Damage to a random enemy Defense unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Wizards are often out adventuring, or sometimes lost deep in study, while their towers are left defenseless. A line of magic missile mines can be the perfect way to alert of an incoming threat, or simply blow one up. Just be extra careful when stepping out to get the mail!
Destroy all adjacent units and resummon them. Destroy this.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Give a random friendly Nature unit +10 Health. (that's not a Botanist)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Give a random friendly Weapon +2 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Even a town full of wizards needs a foundry that can help form raw metals into various shapes and sizes, although it’s really only used to form them into the shapes and sizes of weapon parts.
Trigger 2 adjacent Town units. (can't Trigger other Solo units)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: All Town units above this trigger +2% faster for each Town unit below this. (and the other way around)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Trigger a random friendly Tinker unit. (can't Trigger other Solo units)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Steals 20 Health from an adjacent unit. When this gains Health, it's doubled.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Rafflesias are widely known to be the world’s largest and foulest-smelling flowers, but deep in the densest forests where only druids dare set foot, one can find giant rafflesias that are the size of entire buildings. They feast on nearby matter to grow unbounded. Try not to be nearby.
Passive: When a friendly Weapon attacks, adjacent Town units get +1 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: When this gets Health, give a random friendly Weapon unit +3 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Fatigue starts 5 seconds earlier. (can stack)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Adjacent Defense units gain +20% Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: This flower bursts with luminous energy every morning, bathing anything nearby in magical healing waves of light.
Give the Weapon to the right +0.5 Damage for each friendly Town unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When in Fatigue: Start a 2s cooldown. On Trigger: Trigger all adjacent Town units (can't Trigger other Solo units)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When in Fatigue: Friendly Weapons gain +15% Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: When an adjacent unit gets destroyed, stun 5 random enemy units for 0.5s.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Gets +25 Health for each unique Tag you have. (Tier, Faction, Type, Role)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: When any unit gets destroyed, this gains +2 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Before the world was broken, many old cities featured mysterious statues of a tentacle reaching towards the sky, with a giant eyeball at its end. Some madmen claimed the statues would tremble when death was in the air, but no one believed them, until now. The stone prisons holding back the monsters have started to crumble, and the deep red eyes peer out.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: While trying to develop siege weapons that could compete with raw magic, many towns harnessed the power of fire, hurling exploding combustible pots at enemy cities. The fire is ineffective against stone walls and defenses, but proved particularly destructive to wooden buildings in city centers.
Start of Combat: Gain +20 Health for each enemy Weapon.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Trigger a random friendly Town unit and Stun a random enemy Town unit for 0.5s. (can't Trigger other Solo units)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: The fastest friendly and enemy unit trigger 0.1s slower.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When destroyed, increase the cooldown of a random Enemy unit by 0.2s.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Can be permanently destroyed. After Combat: If it survives, hatches into Mecha Dragon.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: If you have more Town units than your opponent, trigger all adjacent Town units. (can't Trigger other Solo units)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Destroy 2 random adjacent units permanently. For each one destroyed, add a higher Tier unit to your inventory.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Magic portals can be powerful tools to transport items across great distances. They can also be a glorified garbage dump, where wizards toss unwanted items to see if another wizard across the world will trade for something better. As they say, one man’s trash is another man’s Spellbound Rocket.
Force an enemy Weapon to attack one of its allies.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When an adjacent unit triggers, add 3% of its Health to your rightmost unit. (max 30)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Glowberries are able to absorb the lifeforce of anything nearby, releasing tiny floating seedlings into the wind. It’s said anyone who eats a glowberry seed will be cured of their infirmities.
Permanently destroys itself at the end of a fight.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Give a random friendly Weapon unit +0.5 Damage for each unique friendly Nature unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When an adjacent Town unit triggers, give it +5 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Give a friendly Ancient or Magic unit +1 Health. Upgrades with +1 when an adjacent Town unit triggers.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: When this takes Damage, shoot 20% of the Damage back.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Give a random friendly unit of every Faction +2 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Deals Damage equal to 20% of its Health. (Damage can't be buffed otherwise)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Gain 50% of the Health of all adjacent Defense units (that are not Pillars).

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Wizards are always seeking ways to magnify their power, and building an absurdly large hollow pillar to absorb the magical energies in otherwise-lifeless structures is a surprisingly effective way to do it.
Start of Combat: Has +0.5 Damage for each friendly Tinker and Magic unit. When this attacks, it targets 5 random enemies and 1 random friendly unit.  (Damage can't be buffed otherwise)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: If this has no adjacent units, all friendly Town units trigger 7% faster.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: All your Crystals get a +50% bonus. (stacks). When you buy a Cystal Core, get a random Crystal.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: While smaller crystals can be found in abundance since the shattering, these larger spherical formations are much rarer and seem to resonate with the smaller ones to magnify their magical energies.
Steal 3 life from all adjacent Town units, add the total to this unit and to your unit with the most Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Trigger adjacent Start of Combat effects again, then destroy itself. (can't be resummoned during Combat)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Tinker engineers needed a way to unleash a sudden burst of enormous energy, so they created the Super Charger, cramming far too much power into a fragile cylinder, meaning they always explode after use (and sometimes before use)
Can be permanently destroyed. On Destroy: get +3 Mana.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Remove 1 Damage from a random enemy Weapon.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Only shows up when you have 70 or fewer Hitpoints.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Novus wizards discovered a way to harness the body’s pain signals, collecting and crystalizing them into a nearly impenetrable new form of matter.
Give a random friendly unit a random Enchantment.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: In a town full of wizards going about very important business, a service to send a magic scroll to someone across town is quite useful indeed!
Destroy a random adjacent unit, deal double its Health as Damage to the enemy's healthiest unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: These ancient obelisks were often seen piercing the sky of the world, and a few still remain today. It’s said anyone caught in its shadow would be lost to darkness. Its deep crimson runes are unknowable, but any who gaze upon them feel only one thing, a sense of pure evil.
When destroyed, deal 4 Damage to all friendly and enemy units.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: When destroyed, summon 4 random Mines and add 1 to your Inventory.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: After Combat: Copy a random unit on your board, spend mana equal to its Rarity. (that's not a Replicator)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: After the Weapon unit below this triggers, give it +1 Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat & When destroyed: Summon 4 Trees on empty spaces.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: In the deep untouched forests of the old world, plants were able to mature for millenia, taking on forms unseen by civilization. Humble dandelion flowers would grow and flourish until they took the shape of a gnarled old lion, its mane a flowing bouquet of seedlings that would give life to a new generation of forests.
After Combat: Generate a Tree or Shrub.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: Has +20 Damage and +40 Health for every friendly and enemy Ancient unit.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Adjacent Weapons gain +7 Lifesteal

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: The Latchwood Tree is an enormous and dangerous specimen with long vines that latch onto wildlife and absorb their lifeforce. The trees should be avoided at all costs, but the Latchwood’s spores have proven useful to clever Druids who attach them to weaponry, passing on the magical absorption properties.
Passive: When an adjacent Tinker unit triggers, give a random friendly Weapon +1 Damage. Also speed up 3 friendly non-Tinker Town units by 1%.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Summon 4 Toy Turrets if you have space (top, right, bottom, left)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: In Tinker society everyone is encouraged to be an inventor when they grow up, so toy stores that let children build their own machines are quite popular. Many people wonder why children are playing with turrets that fire deadly lasers, but at least it’s better than the old Build-a-Bomb Workshops.
Passive: When this gets Health, also spread it to a random friendly unit (that's not a Bee Keeper)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: After friendly Town units trigger 25 times, your non-Town units gain +3% of their own base Health and Damage.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Target a random enemy unit with a cooldown, stun it and permanently slow it down by +0.1s. (Maximum of 10 seconds)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Adjacent Buffer Bots absorb 1 extra hit. (only shows up when you have a Buffer Bot)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: On Trigger: All your Toy Stores resummon their Toy Turrets. After Combat: Generate a Toy Turret. (only shows up when you have a Toy Store)

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Give a random friendly Magic +1 Health for every Enchantment on your island and give a random adjacent Town unit a random Enchantment.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Passive: Adjacent Town units take 50% less Damage from Explosive, Stun and Pierce (doesn't stack). When they take Damage, this takes the Damage instead.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6

value: Start of Combat: Permanently change this unit's Enchantments into different ones. On trigger: Gain +10 Health. If this has an enchantment, remove it and gain +30 Health.

hint: Normal:0,Friendly Fire:1,Extra Defense Damage:2,Size Scaling:3,Extra Nature Damage:4,Extra Magic Damage:5,Slow Down:6
